reviewText:
Good game. As an ice fisherman myself, I can say that it is exactly what it says it is... Ice Fishing. I think the graphics are OK for what it is, the gameplay is good, and I'm enjoying my time with it so far.

One downside is that there is no tutorial (at least that I noticed). Meaning, if you don't know ice fishing already, you could be lost. Some simple instructions would go a long way.

A couple of tips for starters: You need to run out on the lake, pick a spot, drill a hole with your auger, BAIT your hook/jig (there are grubbs that go on the hook or you won't catch anything). You can vary your depth using your mouse wheel (where I live, slightly off the bottom is where you fish, but other depths can work). There is a strainer next to the hole to keep ice out of the hole (click on it, I think I caught more fish when the hole was clear). Watch the end of the pole, when you get a hit, hit the F button on your keyboard or use the reel icon on the screen to pull up the line. Lastly, there is a bait shop near where you started for bait, etc. and when the time is running down, get back to that area to have your score count! Not exactly review" material
date: but I hope this is some help to you.\n\nAll in all
recommended: a good ice fishing game that I'd recommend to a friend. I haven't tried the multiplayer yet..."
voteText: true

reviewText:
First off, its not bass or ocean fishing, its important to keep that in mind when playing it. Ice fishing is not fast paced or about the fights, its about the right lure in the right location.
Graphics could be better but honestly they are better then alot of other $12 games out there. Animation motions are smooth and did not experience any clipping issues.
Multi-player is a fun idea, seeing others running around digging holes and jumping spot to spot on the ice.
The sounds in the game are accurate and good.
Did not seem to be drawing anything from my second video card but the game ran very smooth with no crashes or hang-ups.
I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys fishing, we dont have enough fishing games out there to pick from and to the collectors of group multiplayer games.
voteText: 36 of 45 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Is it the most realistic ice fishing game? Definitely not. Is it fun? Absolutely! Especially when played with friends over voice chat.

The devs have assuredly played Pro Pilkki before, since there are quite a lot of similarities in the game mechanics and that is not a bad thing. For years Pro Pilkki has been the best ice fishing game out there and it's really a time for it to have some competition. Does Ice Lakes provide the competition? I'd like to think so. It has it's ups and downs but over time this game could take the spot as #1 ice fishing game, assuming the devs will provide updates and fixes to it.

Ice Lakes is still fresh out of the oven and that can be seen, especially on the multiplayer front. Hosting a game / being able to join a friends game can be quite a pain in the buttocks. Setting a password or lowering the max players value don't seem to have an affect. But once you get going, it's really fun and I'm  optimistic that these small problems will be fixed in coming updates.

If you are expecting realism, then you might be a bit disappointed. The fish weights and amount of fish you are able to catch can seem quite absurd at times. 1.2kg ruffe.. that's something I'd like to see IRL ;) If you are up for some arcade ice fishing, then this game is definitely something to try out!

5/5, will recommend!
voteText: 17 of 21 people (81%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
NOTE: This game was given to me by the developer for review purposes. This did not influence my review in any way.

==========================================================
---------------------------------------OVERVIEW-------------------------------------
==========================================================Ice Lakes is a single- and multi-player ice fishing game.

It includes ten different maps and a number of different game types, but really they all boil down to catching the most fish of certain types within the time limit.

==========================================================
----------------------------------------QUALITY-------------------------------------
==========================================================Graphics - Graphics are pretty good, with convincing snow-covered scenery and frozen lakes, and some nice additional touches like rabbits and foxes, cabins, rowboats moored on the frozen shores, etc, to maintain the atmosphere. Player character models aren't great when zoomed in up close (such as when selecting your character), but when playing they look okay, and are animated quite well.

There's a reasonable list of graphics options in case you're playing on an under-powered PC. I played in full HD with everything turned on on a four-year-old gaming laptop, and didn't encounter any performance problems, even after alt-tabbing a number of times.

Sound - Sounds are very simple, but appropriate enough. I found myself playing with some ambient electronic music of my own in the background to fill in the silence, but that's just me.

Gameplay - Ice Lakes is all about ice fishing, so the gameplay involves drilling holes in the ice, baiting your hook, lowering it through the hole into the water below, and wiggling it around until you catch a fish. There's no tutorial or guide included in the game, but after a couple of minutes of experimentation I had the basics down pat, and from there it was just trial and error to try to work out where and how to catch the most and largest fish.

The game includes 10 different maps, and you're able to select from a number of different goals or game types for each map, including a 'free play' option. I used the free play option to learn the basics, but really there's no reason you can't do that after jumping straight into one of the other game types instead.

The other game types involve you competing against a group of other ice fisherman for the specified time, with the winner being the one who catches the most of the specified types and returns to the starting area within the allowed time. I don't know enough about ice fishing in general, or the advanced tactics of Ice Lakes itself, to know if the other computer-controlled characters are acting intelligently, but they're fun to watch and the competition is a welcome addition over free mode. Online multiplayer is an option that I've not yet tried. I believe it plays exactly the same as the single player game, but with your competitors controlled by real people.  Pre-set tournaments are also included and involve playing consecutive competitive levels one after another.

As well as the map assortment, the game keeps you busy with the included achievements, many different types of fish, and a whole host of fishing gear to buy with the cash earned from selling your fish at the market in the starting area.

==========================================================
-------------------------------------PROS & CONS------------------------------------
==========================================================Pros:
+ Pretty good graphics overall, with interesting environments that look quite pretty
+ Attention to detail is good, with a number of little touches for good effect
+ Enthusiastic and responsive developers on the Steam forums for the game
+ Achievements, to give you something more to aim for
+ Trading cards

Cons:
- It can get a bit boring; some random events, such as cracks in the ice, have been suggested in the forums, and would be a welcome addition

==========================================================
--------------------------------------CONCLUSION-----------------------------------
==========================================================I've never been ice fishing in my life, and the topic doesn't interest me that much. That said, however, I found Ice Lakes a fairly relaxing and moderately enjoyable game to play.

It's a game for a niche market, but I believe it fills that niche well, and leaves me with really nothing to complain about. I'd recommend it for anyone into ice fishing, or anyone interested in playing something a bit different.

7/10

reviewText: I remember the days when I was out there myself - the long days in the cold, cold African glaciers, wearing nothing but a pair of Adidas Air Jordan Hiking Boots™ and a tank top sewn by my late grand mother. I would sit there for hours, completely still, waiting for my prey. I remember it like it was yesterday - I caught the Eel out of the corner of my eye as it sat there, under the ice - taunting me. reviewText:
Ice Lakes is exactly what I hoped it to be: a modernized version of popular ice fishing games. You can finally go ice fishing in 3D. Ice Lakes keeps the focus in fishing and there is more customization than in the previous ice fishing games I have played: you can change different hooks to your jigs or you can drop some baits in the water to lure a specific fish a bit better. Meanwhile you can scoop off the ice from your fishing hole. These little things really improve the atmosphere. You can upgrade your gear in the shop after you have earned some money from the games.

It is also noteworthy that the developers in Ice Flake Studios are listening the community and applying hotfixes fast. The biggest problem I found was that fishes' weight was too high, but a hotfix for this was applied on the next day. There is still some tuning in fishes' weight but it is already ALOT better.

I actually sent the developers an e-mail where I asked about future plans and I listed some suggestions that I personally hoped to see in the game. On the next day I got an answer from one of the developers where he took the time to separately answer all of my questions. For example online stats are in the to do -list, as well as adding information of current lake's species so you can see them while fishing. I also said that at the moment it is too easy to reel in bigger fishes and developer answered that they are currently working to improve this, and this should be one of the first improvements they are applying.

All in all I would recommend this game for everyone who likes fishing or fishing games in general. Lets face it, there really is not enough fishing games so Ice Lakes is a very welcome addition.

Lastly some tips I suggest:

- I am fishing holding down Mouse 1"
date: moving the mouse trying to lure the fish. You can reel in the fish pressing "F" or moving the mouse to the top of your screen and releasing "Mouse 1". I changed the "F" key to "Space" so it is possible to just hit the keyboard to reel in your catch.\n\n- If you want to hunt for the biggest fish or you prefer the ocean maps
recommended:
I suggest you save your money for the heaviest equipment to be able to catch them.

- I changed to third person and preferred that immediatly. Using "WASD" to move is the most convenient.

- If you can not catch any fish
hoursPlayed: try scrolling your mouse to try from a different depth."

reviewText:
The game was given to me for review purposes
I am not fan of fishing myself and this is the reason why I won't be playing much more of the game, but I can totally see why people who are into the sport would enjoy their time in the beautiful snowy world of Ice Lakes.

Ice Lakes is a slow-paced competitive fishing game.The game is not exactly realistic and definitely isn't a simulator in my opinion but if worked as a great time killer for me.

Sadly there is no tutorial but the statistics menu helped me start out .The main menu is user friendly, there is no lacking of important graphic/ video and audio settings and the game runs well overall.

Of course you are able to customize your character and your tools progressing through the game using the money you earned by beating the computer or other players in several different game modes.The shop system is balanced.

Overall everything seems fine from a fishing noobies perspective.The game is obviously made by fans of the sport for fans of the sport and I completely understand and respect that . 100% recommended for fishermen who are too lazy to go out!
